channel.title: Help Starting Server
channel.description:
I decided to mess around on my offline server again. The problem is it has been a few months and I have changed a lot of things on my computer so it would not run when I first opened it.
The client seems to work just fine. I'm not sure why the server keeps failing. I remember Crooks helped me fix a similar error last year but not sure how he did it.
Ok so.. I don't know exactly where my problem occurs so I'm just going to post a video of me trying to run the server.
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CkNhJ9vs37Q&feature=youtu.be[/youtube]

item.title: Help Starting Server
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:11, topic:437718"][quote author=Daginith link=topic=540419.msg3963797#msg3963797 date=1333511459]

Everything is set up. I just can’t connect to the server. I have wamp running and all that good stuff… Where do I need to check to see if my ip’s in client and server side are the same?

Or if that is not the problem… Localhost only connects at port 81. How do I change it to port 80?

…webhosts are usually connected in ports 80-88. Why would you want a RSPS connectiong to those ports? o.O

Also, if default RSPS port is 43549
[/quote]
Nope. It’s 43594.[/quote]
Sorry, i must have typed it fast…only 2 numbers off

Read full topic

item.title: Help Starting Server
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:10, topic:437718”][quote author=A Gh0st link=topic=540419.msg3963360#msg3963360 date=1333487544]
Everything is set up. I just can’t connect to the server. I have wamp running and all that good stuff… Where do I need to check to see if my ip’s in client and server side are the same?

Or if that is not the problem… Localhost only connects at port 81. How do I change it to port 80?
[/quote]
…webhosts are usually connected in ports 80-88. Why would you want a RSPS connectiong to those ports? o.O

Also, if default RSPS port is 43549[/quote]
Nope. It’s 43594.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Starting Server
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

A Gh0st:

Can I have java 1.6 and 1.7 on my computer at the same time? If not, which of the programs in the control panel pic do I need to install? It is hard to tell. I tried to do what you said but messed up java completely and had to do a system restore.

you can for sure on linux…not positive about Windows, but if it dosnt let you install, you can download the .tar.gz file, and extract it to the ./java/ dir manually, and you can include the path in all your .bat files.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Starting Server
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

Can I have java 1.6 and 1.7 on my computer at the same time? If not, which of the programs in the control panel pic do I need to install? It is hard to tell. I tried to do what you said but messed up java completely and had to do a system restore.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Starting Server
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

jdk needs removing and install 1.6.0_29

Read full topic

item.title: Help Starting Server
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

Last time I uninstalled java I messed a lot of things up. Just to be sure… which files do I uninstall? And afterwards I’m guessing I’ll have to set my environment variables again.

xgia8y.png1243×591

Read full topic

item.title: Help Starting Server
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Use java 1.6u29 instead of 1.7.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Starting Server
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:2, topic:437718”]too small to see what your typing
Also, its not Linux, no need to do it command line style.

What exactly is going wrong?[/quote]
Can you not maximize it? And I do it via cmd because adding “pause” does not seem to work for my runls.bat file.

I think my problem is in the compile server.bat file.

ebagb5.png667×709

Read full topic
